attachments.title: Deep Learning of Hierarchical Multiscale Differential Equation Time Steppers
attachments.fallback: YouTube Video: Deep Learning of Hierarchical Multiscale Differential Equation Time Steppers
attachments.video_html: <iframe width="400" height="225" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Jfl3dIlSTrU?feature=oembed&autoplay=1&iv_load_policy=3" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

text: Oh yes, I watched this one a few weeks ago too. It is an interesting idea. It is very different than the usual sciml stuff which is about regularizing the loss function with some additional ode based penalty. This was kinda neat the way he used different time stepping networks to combine into a single solver.
